data.title: Agenda
data.meta_description: Explore the agenda for the Stevens Doctoral Program's upcoming 100th anniversary celebration.
data.meta_site_name: The University of Chicago Booth School of Business
data.text:
The Charles M. Harper Center/Ida Noyes Hall

11:00 a.m.-12:00 p.m.: Arrival and check-in at the Harper Center's main entry

Noon–1:00 p.m.: David Booth '71 & Eugene F. Fama, MBA '63, PhD '64, in conversation with CNBC and Museum of American Finance, Harper Room #104 (Lunch provided)

1:00 p.m.-3:00 p.m.: Plenary Session (three speakers), Ida Noyes Cinema

3:00 p.m.-3:30 p.m.: Break in the Winter Garden (coffee provided)

3:30 p.m.-5:00 p.m.: Concurrent Breakout Sessions in Accounting (Harper C07), Behavioral Science (Harper C04), Econometrics and Statistics (Harper 3B), Economics (Harper C05), Finance (Harper C25), Management Science/Operations Management (Harper C03), Marketing (Harper 3A)

Harper Center: 5807 S Woodlawn Ave, Chicago, IL 60637

Ida Noyes Hall: 1212 E. 59th Street, Chicago, IL 60637

The David Rubenstein Forum

5:45 p.m.: Dinner Registration

6:00 p.m.: Cocktail Reception

6:30 p.m.: Dinner *Business attire*

Welcome Remarks, Madhav V. Rajan, Dean and George Pratt Shultz Professor of Accounting

A conversation with Ross Stevens, PhD '96, moderated by Madhav V. Rajan

Panel Introduction

Cliff Asness MBA '91, PhD '94, Founder, Managing Principal and Chief Investment Officer at AQR Capital Management

John Liew, AB '89, MBA '94, PhD '95, Founding Principal at AQR Capital Management

Panel Discussion

Ray Ball MBA '68, PhD '72, The Sidney Davidson Distinguished Service Professor of Accounting

Phil Berger MBA '88, PhD '92, Wallman Family Professor of Accounting

Eugene Fama MBA '63, PhD '64, Robert R. McCormick Distinguished Service Professor of Finance

Ann McGill MBA '85, PhD '86, Sears Roebuck Professor of General Management, Marketing and Behavioral Science

Moderator: Harry Davis, The Roger L. and Rachel M. Goetz Distinguished Service Professor of Creative Management

Rubenstein Forum: 1201 East 60th Street, Chicago, IL, 60637

Title: Increasing linkages between research, teaching, and practice

Friday, May 12, 2023 at 3:30pm-5:00pm in Harper C07

Christine Cuny, PhD '13, Associate Professor of Accounting, Leonard N. Stern School of Business, New York University

Patricia O'Brien, PhD ’85, Professor Emeritus, Financial Accounting, School of Accounting and Finance, University of Waterloo

Eugene Soltes, PhD '09, The McLean Family Associate Professor of Business Administration, Harvard Business School

Beverly Walther, PhD ’96, The Eric L. Kohler Chair in Accounting, Kellogg School of Management, Northwestern University

Moderator: Phil Berger, PhD ’92, The Wallman Family Professor of Accounting, University of Chicago Booth School of Business

Title: How boundaries of accounting research has changed

Saturday, May 13, 2023 at 9am-10:30am in Harper CO7

Matthias Breuer, PhD '18, Associate Professor of Business, Accounting Division, Columbia Business School

April Klein, PhD ’83, KPMG Faculty Fellow and Professor of Accounting, Leonard N. Stern School of Business, New York University

Gregory Waymire, PhD ’84, The Asa Griggs Candler Professor of Accounting, Goizueta Business School, Emory University

Moderator: Ray Ball, PhD ’72, The Sidney Davidson Distinguished Service Professor of Accounting, Emeritus, University of Chicago Booth School of Business
